results.title: BBC News - Syrian held in Germany over Berlin 'suicide attack plan'
results.summary: German police arrest a 17-year-old Syrian suspected of planning a suicide attack in Berlin.
results.body: <body xmlns="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset" xml:space="preserve" xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/article/ddb75078-b47b-7945-8619-e31a5beb5284"><image id="91952625"/><paragraph role="introduction">German police have arrested a Syrian teenager suspected of planning a suicide attack in Berlin.</paragraph><paragraph>The suspect, 17, was arrested in the Uckermark, a district in Brandenburg, the state's Interior Minister, Karl Heinz SchrÃ¶ter, announced.</paragraph><paragraph>He entered Germany in 2015 and sought asylum, police said. Details of the alleged plot were not released.</paragraph><paragraph>In December, a jihadist killed 12 people with a lorry at a Berlin Christmas market.</paragraph><paragraph>That attack by Anis Amri, a Tunisian, put security services under intense scrutiny because of the way in which the attacker, who was later shot dead by police in Italy, evaded their surveillance and crossed European borders undetected.</paragraph><paragraph>Special forces arrested the Syrian teenager after police received a tip-off, Brandenburg police <!-- CPS Asset ID: 40096915 --><link><caption>tweeted</caption><url platform="highweb" href="https://twitter.com/PolizeiBB/status/869534845168439296/photo/1"/></link> (in German).</paragraph><paragraph>The suspect had been living in a home for unaccompanied underage refugees in Uckermark since 2016 and had never before come to the attention of police. </paragraph><paragraph>He is currently being questioned and the home is being searched by the state criminal investigation office, Brandenburg police said.</paragraph><paragraph>Operations are ongoing, the police added.</paragraph></body>
results.shortFormBody: <shortFormBody xmlns="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset" xml:space="preserve" xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/article/ddb75078-b47b-7945-8619-e31a5beb5284"><paragraph>German police have arrested a Syrian teenager suspected of planning a suicide attack in Berlin.</paragraph><paragraph>The suspect, 17, was arrested in the Uckermark, a district in Brandenburg, the state's Interior Minister, Karl Heinz SchrÃ¶ter, announced.</paragraph><paragraph>He entered Germany in 2015 and sought asylum, police said. Details of the alleged plot were not released.</paragraph><paragraph>In December, a jihadist killed 12 people with a lorry at a Berlin Christmas market.</paragraph></shortFormBody>

items.headline: Migrant crisis: Germany sees massive drop in asylum seekers

93358262.caption: Although the number of arrivals was down in 2016, the number of applications actually rose
93358262.altText: Migrants queuing in Berlin in October 2015

93354886.caption: Although the number of arrivals was down in 2016, the number of applications actually rose
93354886.altText: Migrants arrive in Munich in September 2016

93358267.caption: Despite the EU-Turkey deal, some 7,000 migrants from Asia and the Middle East are stranded in Serbia
93358267.altText: Migrants wait in line to receive free food during a snowfall outside a derelict customs warehouse in Belgrade (9 Jan)

93358331.caption: Although the number of arrivals was down in 2016, the number of applications actually rose
93358331.altText: Migrants arrive in Munich in September 2016

items.shortHeadline: Massive drop in German asylum seekers
items.summary: Germany says 280,000 new arrivals sought asylum in 2016, a drop of over 600,000 on the previous year.

items.headline: Berlin truck attacker Anis Amri killed in Milan

93089921.caption: German federal police released images of Anis Amri
93089921.altText: German federal police handout pictures of Berlin market attack suspect Anis Amri (21 December)

93112051.caption: IS released a video showing Amri pledging allegiance
93112051.altText: image grab taken from a propaganda video showing Anis Amri

93105303.caption: The shootout took place in the Sesto San Giovanni area of Milan
93105303.altText: Police and forensics at the scene of a shootout in Milan

93105305.caption: The shootout took place in the Sesto San Giovanni area of Milan
93105305.altText: Italian police cordon off an area after a shootout between police and a man in Milan"s Sesto San Giovanni neighbourhood, early Friday, Dec. 23, 2016.

93105307.caption: Mourning continues at Breitscheidplatz in central Berlin, where the attack took place
93105307.altText: Candles and flowers are placed at Breitscheidplatz in remembrance of the victims of the 19 December terrorist attack in Berlin, Germany, 23 December 2016.

93105310.altText: A weapon is marked as evidence as it lays on the ground on 23 December 2016 after Anis Amri shootout

93046280.caption: The lorry's Polish driver, Lukasz Urban, was found dead in the passenger seat

93107168.caption: Police officer Cristian Movio was injured in the shoulder in the shootout
93107168.altText: Injured police officer Cristian Movio talks on the phone in hospital, bandages on his shoulder

93112049.altText: image grab taken from a propaganda video showing Anis Amri

items.shortHeadline: Berlin attacker shot dead in Milan
items.summary: Italian police shoot dead Berlin attacker Anis Amri near a Milan train station after he opened fire.
items.title: BBC News - Berlin truck attacker Anis Amri killed in Milan
